reviews.sentence: LOVED my stay here. I was there last weekend for my first visit but it will not be my last. I was on the 9th floor and the suite I was in was LOVELY. When booking you might want to call instead of booking on line. The rate for the suite was listed on line and still is at 45810 a night but I actually ended paying quite a bit more per night. I enjoyed it anyway and will be coming back. Friendly staff nice restaurants in the hotel and nearby. Housekeeping was very thorough but forgot to restock the fridge a couple of times for the money I ended up paying I would have liked to see housekeeping clean room earlier and restock the beverage fridge daily. The views from my balcony were great and the room was very quiet and comfortable. And Kramers Bookstore is right across the street from hotel.
Exquisite. Hotel was great. Dupont cafe in the hotel was amazing. The room service was the only thing that was not amazin.

Not designed for women. The bathroom lighting was poor for applying makeup. There were no dressers and only a very small drawer in each nightstand. The towels and robes feel like too much detergent is used in the laundry. When we arrived there was a used q tip on the bathroom floor under the sink. It did get picked up the following day. The overall contemporary design was nice. We had a nice view. Good central location.

Nice location. The hotel is in a good location. The Metro is a short walk from the hotel. The staff was exceptionally nice. The downside for me was the room. My wife and I were unable to get a room with a king sized bed. The room had 2 double beds which were not overly comfortable. I do not know if a king size bed would have been better. Also the bathroom is a bit odd. The sink area is not closed off from the rest of the room which can be annoying if one is sleeping in the bed adjacent to this area. Also the shower has a small barrier. If you are not careful with the shower curtain the floor outside the shower can get flooded.

Staff very friendly and helpful great cafe lively bar lovely room. Location was perfect for my purposes. The concierge was helpful in making suggestions for our family and friends arriving In a month to attend our sons wedding. Room was lovely. Staff very helpful and friendly. The room used space well and the bathroom was lovely and quite beautiful. Temperature thermostat in my room seemed inaccurate. In spite of setting it never maintained a col air flowing condition. Lighting over sink could have been better.

really nice hotel around the corner from the Metro. The hotel is in a rather hip area but is right around the corner from the Metro Station for going sightseeing. There are a ton of really good restaurants and bars in the area. We stayed here before and the rooms are nice and the staff could not be nicer. The last time we stayed at this hotel a hurricane hit the area closing down the whole city including airports. We got stuck for two extra days waiting for the airport to open. This hotel said that the guests who were stuck had priority on the rooms and the room price did not go up. They had an opportunity to stick it to the guests and they graciously did not. As far as I am concerned they have a customer for life when i come to the DC area. The hotel restaurant and bar are good and all you have to do is walk out the door to a ton of really good bars and restaurants. The cable TV was in and out but I did not come to DC to watch TV anyway.

5 night stay. My husband and I stayed here recently. The room was small but well kept and clean. The staff was helpful especially the doormen who were always ready to help by holding a door or providing directions. The hotel is located in a good spot near the metro entrance with lots of placed to eat nearby. There in also a CVS and Safeway very close the the hotel. Do to it being so close to the circle there is some traffic noise at times but it did not bother us.

Great stay. This was our first time traveling with our two month old which was a bit stressful to plan for. However while booking I spoke with Tory who was extremely helpful during the booking process. She made sure to accommodate for the baby by booking us with a fridge and gave me the idea to include a kettle in our room to heat up our babies milk which I did n’t even think about. She made sure we could have our babysitter stay in the room next to us. She was very sweet and just went above and beyond for us.

Rooms are starting to show a lot of wear. My room had a lot of signs of wear. The fittings on the shower and sink were all very loose and falling apart. It was 80 degrees outside my AC was set to 65 and after a full day of running the AC the room could not be cooled lower than 75 degrees. There was also a lot of humidity in the room as well. Those were the only negatives but they made for an uncomfortable stay. The staff was great very friendly and polite. If the rooms were in better condition it would have been great. The staff was very friendly and helpful The hotel is right on the circle so you have fast access to all the restaurants and shops in Dupont Circle as well as the metro for transport. The rooms need to be maintained better.
Enjoyed. Location bar staff. Two bed room was a little cramped but was functional clean and quiet. Bath vanity needs better lighting. Overall no problems.

Overall our stay was okay. I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it to friends. Beds were comfortable and the marble in the bathroom was nice. Our room was unbearably hot. With the thermostat set at 65 degrees the room was 78 degrees which made it incredibly hard to sleep. The afternoon sun streamed through the front windows and the air conditioner simply could not keep up. I did not like the frosted glass in the bathroom. A door would afford more privacy.

Good. The Hotel was good and people friendly. The problem we had was that the price and amenities announced by Bokingcom was not the final result. I do not know if this was due to the Hotel or to Booking. but1. The price announced by Booking was not the one we paid finally we did not pay in advance. So if you have discount with Booking it is not sure that this discount will be applied by the Hotel2. It was indicated in Booking reservation breakfast included. Instead we have received a voucher of 25 per person. It is almost impossible to have a good breakfast for 25. taxes and tip included. We had to pay more each morning. Nevertheless I recommend this Hotel as the room was nice.

Nice hotel great restaurant fantastic staff terrible bathroom setup in room. The hotel is okay the staff is fantastic restaurant serves great food. But the bathroom setup in the room leaves no privacy behind at all. Even with my own family I feel it was a problem. And I am not a prude.

Great location. I chose a hotel in the Dupont Circle area since I had read up on the area and found out that it has lots of cafés and restaurants. Good move. The hotel is perfectly located in this area. In comparison to some other hotels I looked at in the area this one had quite favorable rates which is why I ended up booking it. Rooms are not particularly fancy but they are good size and my bed a king size was very comfortable. My room was on the 7th floor and faced the inner side good for me since I am a light sleeper and it was very quiet with very little street noise. Bathroom was clean also of good size. All in all this was a good stay. I would return if the price is right like it was this time. Check in and check out were a breeze and the staff nice.

Dupont Circle Hotel is awesome. Everything about the hotel was great. From walking up the drive way to the front desk and all employees that I encountered. I was there for a business meeting and everything was great. Love the modern bathroom and very comfortable room. The hotel is centric to public transport and great walking area. Will definitely come back and stay here on personal travel too.
Great location comfortable rooms and very helpful service.
Great location beautiful rooms and excellent service. The staff was attentive and anxious to please. it is all nice and new and felt very luxurious for the price.

Great location and service. We selected this hotel due to the location. We ended up very pleased with the service room and yes the location. There are complete services in the hotel as well as several bistros and restaurants very nearby. We found this to be a very walkable location with Metro station right across the park. We would definitely stay here again. Derek at the concierge desk made excellent suggestions and assisted us with all our questions.

Great way to ring in the New Year. Came into DC to meet some friends and stayed here for four nights. The lobby was lovely and decorated very tastefully for the holidays. The staff was very pleasant and helpful from the moment you arrive and always greeted you accordingly. I upgraded to the 9th floor after the first night because the first room did not have a tub. The new room had a wonderful deluxe tub and separate shower and the room itself was more spacious and had high ceilings. The Doyle bar was very festive and fun on NYE and the Pembroke was classy. We also received complimentary champagne and fruit with a kind note on NYE which was a nice touch. The staff from all the establishments were 5 Star. I will return on my next visit to DC.

Exceeded already high expectations. I had the pleasure of spending 2 nights and three days at The Dupont for New Years. My expectations were met or surpassed in every area. Upon arrival check in was easy and staff were courteous and thoughtful. I was able to chose my preferred paper for the morning bags were handled quickly and I was in my room within minutes. The room itself was fantastic and I could tell the attention given to the small details. My room had a beautiful view overlooking Dupont Circle. I was on the top floor in a one bedroom suite. There was a wall of windows with high ceilings and large sliding doors in both the main room and the bedroom. The weather was great for Jan 60 degrees. so I was able to enjoy the large and spacious patio. I made great use of the overhead heater provided on the patio a very unexpected and well appreciated amenity. The bathroom was amazing. heated floors. heated towel rack. large shower area with multiple shower heads. The bathroom is stocked with an array of toiletries and supplies not found in many hotels and they are good size too. If you forgot anything it will be there for you. The bedroom and bedding were soft and comfortable. and the room was quiet. You would never know you are right above the busiest circle in DC. The room went from bright and open to various shades of dark and subtle. The lighting options are numerous and the curtains allow for complete blackout while you sleep. The electronics allowed me to play music with ease. I would have been satisfied with all of the above but The Dupont went above and beyond with its attention to little details. The mini bar was well stocked AND unlike similar hotels all non alcoholic drinks were included in cost of room. There was an espresso machine and a wide array of waters juices and sodas. The staff replenished the fridge often. The turndown service was on point. slippers robes chocolate all presented in excellence. On New Years Eve our room was given a nice bottle of champagne to celebrate on the balcony. The staff was ready and willing to answer any questions. They directed me to great spots around the Dupont Circle area. The Do Not Disturb button by the bed allowed me to dictate when the room was cleaned. The housekeeping staff does an amazing job. I do n’t know how they do it all because they are quiet and efficient. The hotel lobby was open and inviting. It provided a great spot to read paper have a coffee and people watch. The workout facility had everything I needed right there to achieve a great workout so if you travel light. no worries the gym has it all. I did n’t eat at the restaurant as I explored the city but the bar area where the New Years Party was held is well decorated and well served. I ca n’t wait to stay here again.
